section.title: Account Summary
section.para: The Account Summary function allows the user to see a summary of balances for accounts they are authorised to use.

section.title: Account Summary - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Account Summary function, from the tool bar, select Account Services > Account Summary.

section.title: Account Summary Selection
section.para: When the Account Summary option is selected from the Account Services menu on the toolbar, a navigation menu on the left hand side of the page provides a list of related functions that are available. The system will display a list of accounts that the user is authorized for and a summary of their current balances.

note.para: If the user is a multibank customer, he can select a specific bank if he wishes to view the account summary of one bank only.

section.para: This menu provides a number of functions as follows:

listitem.para: Displays the balance on the current date in the user’s default time zone.
Displays the transaction summary of an account.
Displays the balance for all the Call and Notice accounts for all the currencies and entities.

note.para: From the menu, Current Balance, Account and Projected Balance are described in this topic. Account Details and Regional Account View are described in other sections of this document.

section.title: Current Balance
section.para: When the Current Balance function is selected, the system will display a list of accounts the user is authorised for, and a summary of their current balances. The balance is displayed for the current date in the user’s default timezone in DD Month YYYY format.
There are three lists, one for each type of account:

para.emphasis: List of Accounts (as of DD Month YYYY)

listitem.para: Lists all savings, current, term deposit and treasury accounts

para.emphasis: List of Fixed/Structured Deposits & Structured Investment

listitem.para: Lists loan and investment accounts
Lists all accounts not held by the primary bank

section.para:
The user can use the Search Option the fields displayed at the top of the screen to filter the list. These are the Company, Entity, Account Number or Equivalent Ccy to view fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
If the user has more than one bank, then a new field Bank will appear. The user has to select a bank to have access to its account summary
There is also a download button that allows the results to be saved as a file on the executing PC. Click this button and select the required option from the list shown. The options are:

listitem.para: PDF downloads the list to the PC as PDF file.
CSV downloads the list to the PC as Comma-Separated Values file.

section.para: Use the PDF or CSV option to export the list as a report allowing it to be customized further for various office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, save the file (default name is pendingIP.xxx) or directly open it to launch Excel if it is available on the workstation.
Three account lists are provided:

listitem.para: A list of Accounts - for all internal accounts.
A list of Fixed/Structured Deposits & Structured Investment - for Term Deposit and investment accounts.
A list of External Accounts - for external bank accounts.

section.para:
The columns returned in the list of accounts are the following: (not all fields are displayed for all accounts)
Field
Description
Account
The currency, number and descriptions of the account.
Account type
The type of account.
Ccy
The currency the account is held in. (not shown for Term Deposit and investment accounts)
Product Type
The type of investment or Term Deposit (Term Deposit and investment accounts only)
Deposit Currency
The currency of the account (Term Deposit and investment accounts only)
Amount
The amount of the Term Deposit or investment (Term Deposit and investment accounts only)
Ledger Balance
The ledger balance of the account, if available, in it's local currency. (not shown for Term Deposit and investment accounts)
Available Balance
The available balance in the account, if available. (not shown for Term Deposit and investment accounts)
Equivalent Available Balance
The available balance in the account, if available, in the requested currency.
Equivalent Amount
The available balance in the account, if available, in the requested currency. (Term Deposit and investment accounts only)
Principal Amount
The principal amount of the term deposit or investment.
Equivalent Principal Amount (USD)
The principal amount in the account, if available, in the requested currency.

Below the account information is a summary of all the accounts for each Entity the user has access to, with its Equivalent Ledger Balance. Click any account listed to display an Account Statement for that account.
When the Account Statement function is selected, the system will display a list of criteria that must be selected to identify the account and period of the statement.
The list is not displayed until search criteria has been entered and the Search button has been clicked. The fields required are as follows:

row.entry: The company the user belongs to.
Enter the Entity the account belongs to. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid Entities.
Enter the account number of the required statement. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid accounts.

entry.para: Select the period the statement should report on. Valid periods are: Current Day Previous Day Current Month Previous Month From: to: - enter the from and to statement dates.

section.para: There is also a download button that allows the results to be saved as a file on the executing PC. Click this button and select the required option from the list shown. The options are:

listitem.para: PDF downloads the list to the PC as PDF file.
CSV downloads the list to the PC as Comma-Separated Values file.
MT940 downloads the list to the PC as a SWIFT compatible file.

section.para: Use the CSV, SpreadSheet or MT940 option to export the list as a report allowing it to be customised further for various office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, save the file or directly open it to launch in the default viewer if available on the workstation.
When all fields have been completed, click the SEARCH button to produce the statement. The statement produced will show the following columns:

entry.para: The date the transaction took place.
The time the transaction took place.
The balance in the account, after the transaction.
The above details are for the PDF and CSV downloads. However, for MT940, the details are in the SWIFT format and are given in the rows below.
The rows in the SWIFT format are represented by codes. The codes and the corresponding decriptions are given below.

note.para: The rows with details will be available in the downloaded statement. Rows where details have not been entered will not appear in the statement.

para.programlisting: 20 - Transaction Reference Number (Mandatory) 21 - Related Reference (Optional) 25 - Account Identification (Mandatory) 28C - Statement Number/Sequence Number (Mandatory) 60a - Opening Balance (Mandatory) 61 - Statement Line (Optional) 86 - Information to Account Owner (Optional) 62a - Closing Balance (Booked Funds) (Mandatory) 64 - Closing Available Balance (Optional) 65 - Forward Available Balance (Optional) 86 - Information to Account Owner (Optional)

note.para: All amounts are displayed in the account currency.

section.para:
Additional Posting Details for transactions can be viewed using the View
icon. This icon is available if Additional Posting Details is applicable to a transaction. The popup displays the following details:

entry.para: The number of the account associated with the transaction.
The back office reference number for the transaction.
The cheque number used in the transaction. This is displayed if the transaction is a cheque related one.
The balance in the account, after the transaction.
The time the transaction took place.
The first reference for the transaction.
The second reference for the transaction.
The third reference for the transaction.
The fourth reference for the transaction.

section.title: Account
section.para: This function displays the transactions summary of an account. To display the transactions related to an account:

listitem.para: On the Account Services menu, click Account Summary. In the Account Summary main menu, click Account. The Account page appears. lternatively, if the Account Summary, Account Statement or Account Details functions have already been selected, there will be a link to the Account function in the left hand side navigation list.

Enter values in the Entity and Account Number fields. Specify the Date Range. Click Search. The Account Details - Current Month and Movement Details are displayed. For more information about the search fields and the display fields, see the Account Selection section.

section.para: There is also a download button that allows the results to be saved as a file on the executing PC. Click this button and select the required option from the list shown. The options are:

listitem.para: PDF downloads the list to the PC as PDF file.
CSV downloads the list to the PC as Comma-Separated Values file.
MT940 downloads the list to the PC as a SWIFT compatible file.

section.para: Use the CSV, SpreadSheet or MT940 option to export the list as a report allowing it to be customised further for various office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, save the file or directly open it to launch in the default viewer if available on the workstation.

section.title: Account Selection
section.para: The Search Options section and the results section display the following fields.

entry.para: (Editable) Entity mapped to the customer. This field is available only if your company has entities defined and you are attached to one or more entities. If you are attached to more than one, click the magnifying glass icon to select one. If you are attached to only one, the field is preset to that entity and cannot be changed. This field is hidden if there are no entities mapped to the customer. The magnifying glass icon displays all the entities mapped to the customer.
To select an Entity using the magnifying glass icon:

listitem.para: Click the magnifying glass icon. The List of Entities popup window appears.
To refine the entity list, enter values in the Abbreviated Name and Name fields. Click Search. The list of entities appears.
Select the abbreviated name of the required entity. The Entity and Name fields are populated.

entry.para: Reference account number assigned to an account in the treasury back office.

listitem.para: Click the magnifying glass icon adjacent to the Account Number field. The List of Accounts popup window appears.
Enter the values in the Account Number, Ccy, and Description fields to refine the list of accounts.
Click Search. The list of account appears. To select an account, click the Account Number of the required account. The selected account is displayed in the Account Number field.

entry.para: Date range of the transactions to be displayed. Valid periods are: Current Day Previous Day Current Month Previous Month From: to: - enter the from and to statement dates.

section.title: Account Details
section.para: The Search Options section displays the following fields and additional fields with balances based on the date range selection:

row.entry: Name of the entity mapped to the customer.
Reference account number assigned to an account in the back office.

entry.para: Additional information related to an account.
Balance amount available in the account.

section.title: Projected Balance
section.para: This function displays the balance for all the Call and Notice accounts for all the currencies and entities.

section.title: Projected Balance - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Projected Balance function, from the tool bar, select Account Services > Account Summary > Projected Balance.

Alternatively, if the Account Summary, Account Statement or Account Details functions have already been selected, there will be a link to the Projected Balance function in the left hand side navigation list.

section.title: Projected Balance - Selection
section.para: When the Projected Balance function is selected, the List of Accounts page is displayed. Click the Search Options link to display a list of search criteria fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter. The list can be searched using the following fields:

note.para: To display all the records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

row.entry: Reference account number assigned to an account in the treasury back office.
Enter the entity assigned to the user. If Entity is selected, all the Call and Notice accounts belonging to the customer is displayed in the List of Savings Accounts

entry.para: Date till when the projected balance must be retrieved.

section.para: The columns returned in the list of FX Inquiry are the following:

entry.para: Name of the account with Currency Account Number and Type as specified in the treasury back office.
Reference account number assigned to an account in the treasury back office.

section.para: Select one of the records to view Projected Balance Summary and Projected Balance Activity related to the account.

section.title: Projected Balance Summary
section.para: The following fields are displayed in the Projected Balance Summary section.

entry.para: Date of transactions such as deposit and withdrawal related to an account.
Amount deposited to an account on the Effective Date.
Amount withdrawn from an account on the Effective Date.
Net amount available in an account on the Effective Date.
Net balance available in an account on the Effective Date.

section.title: Projected Balance Activity
section.para: The following fields are displayed in the Projected Balance Activity section.

entry.para: Treasury back office transaction reference ID.
Description of a deposit and withdrawal transaction.
Effective date of the deposit or withdrawal transaction.
Date when the deposit or withdrawal transaction is initiated.
Date when the deposit amount has been credited in the account.
Date when the withdrawal amount has been debited from the account.
